website_summaries.verdict: A solid and straightforward product that comes at an exceptionally affordable price.
pros: We love how easy this product is to use — just plug in your devices and you're good to go
Simply press the "Switch" button to change the devices
No extra remote that could be lost
cons: The red "Select" light can be off-putting to some users during nighttime viewing

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Simple to hook up & use :)
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Nice it does not require power to work :) Note if you are using a Fire Stick no matter what USB splitter you use the Fire Stick Is too wide and takes up two ports (I have tired other splitters as well and have the same issue so its the Fire Stick not the splitter but good to note so you know how many ports you need).
customer_reviews.author: Amanda R.

customer_reviews.title: Switching inputs made easy! My 4 yr old can do it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my children's single hdmi input tv. Before this we had to switch between three different cables. An adult was needed. Now my 4 yr old can reach the button to switch inputs. The tv would not read a new input without restarting before. Now with this splitter it reads new inputs with no problem! No more restarting! Excellent for the price and what it is!
customer_reviews.author: V.Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Love mine
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely what you need. So you don't have to switch out cables when you have multiple HDMI devises. You can see I have my fire stick in one port and my Xbox one and cable in another. There is no noticeable lag or glitch in picture quality. This is very nice and will save t.v. Port from wear. Push the button to change what port you want to use. I'll use the third port for the PS4 of my grandsons station.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Spruell

customer_reviews.title: HDMI 3 Port Switch...
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to hookup. Worked the 1st time and every time since I installed it. Found other products that were much more expensive and as described did nothing more than this product. Glad I found it on Amazon.....Thanks
customer_reviews.author: John Radney

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: My monitor only has one HDMI input so imagine how frustrating it is having to keep switching the HDMI wires behind it. Not only that, but I always fear that switching the wires back and forth will make the plug-in on my monitor wear out. I have my Nintendo Switch, Playstation 4 and Apple TV all connected and this switch has made my life so much easier. The first one I received stopped working after the first couple days but the seller sent me a new one right away and I haven’t had any issues since. Excellent customer service. So happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but didn't even last a year.
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Purchased on Jan 18th and it failed on 11/27 At least it was cheap, ordered a better one..
customer_reviews.author: TLMKC

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned after 1.5 mos.
customer_reviews.text: Beware, the cord is too short. I have to plug in the back of the TV and won't even reach the front of the TV. It will be a struggle to switch between ports. It is now sitting at the edge until I find another suitable solution. Update: After only a month one of the port stopped working.... very disappointing, Update: After 1.5 mos, all the ports are not working properly, you need to plug, unplug and hope for the best to work.
customer_reviews.author: JCNJ

customer_reviews.title: I was hesitant to get a splitter like this at first because I remember back in day ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently got a Nintendo Switch and realized that I had more devices than I had HDMI ports. I was hesitant to get a splitter like this at first because I remember back in day they could cause some quality loss. I'm pleased to note that not only is there no quality loss but the splitter has been a joy to use. The satisfying click as you press the button to change the input is nice and it's located in a place where you won't accidentally change it. I can't recommend this splitter enough.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Farley

customer_reviews.title: Sketchy advertising.
customer_reviews.text: I'm conflicted about how I should review this device. It is advertised as supporting 4K, but the paperwork that came with the device says it outputs at a maximum of 1080p. That's fine for me because my TV is 1080p, but people getting this for their 4K TV will be disappointed. If you only need this for a 1080p TV then I recommend it. It's been working great for me. Look for something else if you're looking for a 4K signal, though.
customer_reviews.author: J. Voss

customer_reviews.title: Not for PC use despite showing support.
customer_reviews.text: Connecting to an ACER monitor to have a 3 way connection with a PS4, Xbox one S and nintendo switch but none of the ports display anything despite having power.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: ***update***I did love it, until one day it quit working. Didnt even have it 7 months. I love it! So easy to switch between the different hdmi cords. I recommend this to anyone who needs it. If i needed another id purchase this one again.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't switch on its own
customer_reviews.text: *UPDATE * I'm lowering my star review because the company emailed me and offered me a refund IF I remove my negative review. Wat?! I'm not going to remove my review and now I'm lowering the star rating; now they're just being dishonest! *Original* The picture quality is good and the sound quality is good. This is a major problem for me; it doesn't switch on its own! I have to get up and click the bottom to make it switch. This is so annoying! I had one before (worse quality) that switches on its own and I'll probably go back to using that since this one doesnt so it!
customer_reviews.author: London

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend - Did not work
customer_reviews.text: I connected this product to a Samsung TV thru a Samsung HW-N850 Soundbar with a ROKU Streaming Stick, a Dish Hopper and a Sony DVD Player. I tried to manually switch between the 3 input devices - did not work. I tried to automatically switch between the devices - did not work. There was no TV signal only static on the screen. All 3 worked with the TV when connected directly to the Soundbar. I did not send it back to Amazon because it would be too much effort for only $8.99. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H

customer_reviews.title: Only works for 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: It only worked for about 2 weeks until it stopped working. Initially it worked fine with my ps4 and Nintendo switch but now it doesn't stream anything at all I even tried it with different TVs and different hdmis but to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: sami

customer_reviews.title: HDMI Switch Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the switch since November 2017 for my Macbook Pro and Xbox connection to an LCD display. It stopped working today. I accidentally bought this switch instead of the Fosmon HDMI switch. Very disappointed but glad I purchased a 4K monitor that has 2 HDMI ports so I don't need to switch anymore.
customer_reviews.author: vestokes

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with PS4 and PC plugged in at all
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine with my pc but once my PS4 was plugged in it stopped working Update: Got in my replacement and still doesn’t work. Bottom line is if you want to plug more than one device into your computer monitor that only has one HDMI port this is not the product for you. Because it does not work at all
customer_reviews.author: Jack Patterson

customer_reviews.title: It does work... Just not well.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so I can switch between my PC and my PS4. It works every time but only after many times blinking on and off until it finally decides to recognize what is on. For the PC, it works every time as intended, immediately showing my PC feed onto my monitor. As for the PS4 (also Xbone) it blinks on and off for a long time before it finally shows up. I almost returned it but decided that the slight inconvenience was nothing compared to the alternative of wearing out my HDMI port on the back of my monitor. So it does work... Just not well.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Fullfilled my needs
customer_reviews.text: The HDMI splitter was just the item that I needed for my flat screen tv and devices. Add to the fact that it had three input ports was also nice for expansion or even monitors with limited or even a single HDMI input ports. The user manual did mention the feature that automatically switch the input cable in sequence when one is powered off, though I was not able to test this feature to the fullest as the devices involved were the PS3 and SNES mini. I'm sure that it would have otherwise limited the need to physically press the input button, though having a physical button is still a nice backup.
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso P. Posadas Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, But....
customer_reviews.text: After my TV was hit by lightning, I lost 1 HDMI input. This unit works perfectly to split the remaining port for use with multiple devices. However, the ports are so close together I am only able to plug two devices into it at any one time. Fortunately, I only need two but it would be nice if the ports were a bit farther apart. Also, the HDMI cord attached to the unit is VERY short and I ended up having to purchase an additional HDMI extender cord.
customer_reviews.author: breakofday5

customer_reviews.title: The signal is unstable
customer_reviews.text: I have limited HDMI ports on my old TV, so I bought this HDMI extension switch for all my game consoles. I was satisfied with the function that just meets my needs. But after using a while, I found that the signal to the TV is very unstable, the graph blink and flash randomly, I connect the HDMI directly between the TV and the console, then the issue is gone, so it is the problem of the product itself. I have to stop using it since I cannot bear the flashing anymore. (Attention, this is a switcher between three HDMI channels NOT a hub, you cannot use it to cast screen to multiple monitors or screens!)
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Feng

customer_reviews.title: Trash!!!
customer_reviews.text: Too bad there is no zero star. Complete piece of trash. Does not work with Comcast and my DVD player. Doesn't switch by itself. This was the reason I bought this so I wouldn't have to go to the back of the TV and pull cables!!!
customer_reviews.author: NRC

customer_reviews.title: Not a Fan
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my TV has only 2 HDMI inputs, and I needed 3 (DVD, ROKU, and Cable). I had two issues. First, the design is poor. Bh having the "male" output on one side and the three "female" inputs on the opposite, there is no way to place it on a shelf/mantle/etc that looks decent. If everything was on the same side, you could have the cables all pointing away and the control buttons on the front. But that's not possible. So it looks awful aesthetically. The second problem was that when I plugged a Roku into one of the inputs, it acted very sluggish. Remote would not consistently control it. I finally unhooked the whole thing.
customer_reviews.author: Sprtsgy

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: So it does not automatically select the hdmi according to what is powered on as stated in the instructions but it’s works. I had an issue getting a picture from one of the hdmi inputs on my tv but I connected this in another spot and it worked fine. My tv sits close to the wall so it’s a bit difficult to get your hand back there to switch inputs but that’s because it’s wall mounted not an issue with the device. Overall good purchase for the price. Arrived in good condition with clear instructions. So far I’m satisfied with the purchase. Note the little indicator light stays on even when the tv power is off.
customer_reviews.author: Rene

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly and is high quality
customer_reviews.text: I use this splitter with my computer and tv, and have added my play station to it and my amazon fire stick. It's much easier to switch between the three items with a simple push of a button instead of finding the buttons on the back of the tv (I don't have a remote for it). I actually recommended it for a friend of mine who has dexterity issues, as it's a real simple way to switch between his media choices (computer/playstation/other gaming systems/etc)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Annoyingly inadequate.
customer_reviews.text: We succumbed to the very attractive price point but the price we paid in its operation went well beyond any savings. The most annoying feature was each port NOT being individually recognized by any of our televisions which meant that visually on the screen we never knew where we were in the inputs. Subsequently, the most aggravating feature was having to get up and physically toggle between our inputs on this device if we wanted to change the input sources. It shouldn’t force that kind of an outcome. We should have been able to control all docked inputs through our existing Remote Control Input.
customer_reviews.author: Prof. H

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: We bought a Fire Stick for our n on-smart TV. I didn't realize we only had 1 HDMI port on it and that was being used by our service provider connection. This splitter made it easy to add 2 more HDMI ports. When I switch from TV to the Fire Stick it's simple and instantaneous. The picture running through this splitter is excellent (it's not a 4K TV) whether we're using the provider input for the Fire Stick
customer_reviews.author: G. Meisner

customer_reviews.title: Not a real 4K
customer_reviews.text: So I connected it to my PS4 and XBOX ONE X (4K) and my PlayStation works fine until you play a higher quality game and every shadow turns white and my Xbox X shows me the main menu but when I open the game (4K game or regular ones) whole screen turns black and I have to disconnect from this adapter and connect it directly to get my screen back. Awful product. Good thing amazon got it returned for me
customer_reviews.author: rovingie

customer_reviews.title: I'm unhappy with mine.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this knowing I'd need it, but didn't know when. That was a long time ago, well past the thought of returning. The problem is that I still need one! This unit has a sharp, erratic, momentary, video "snow" moment way too often. It may be 5 seconds between, or 5 minutes. Very annoying. (Yes, I repeatedly changed out devices and cables. This unit was the common denominator.) On the plus side, the box/cables are of sturdy construction. There are no active seller return links after this long, so I do not fault the seller, just the product. They have not been contacted.
customer_reviews.author: Daneel

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Change Inputs Automatically
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because we have two other in the house from different brands and they work flawlessly. Without needing to get up, the switch changes the input to the other powered on device every time. This on the other hand, does not. I have tried with an Apple TV, Roku, PS4, Xbox One X, PS3 and a Nintendo Switch and finally gave up. Don’t waste your money, don’t waste your time and don’t waste your sanity. I gave 2 stars because the pass through does work on all ports if you manually get up and click the button.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Strobeck

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected with no discernible difference in picture quality from either device plugged in.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on January 20 2020 and installed today, February 10 2020. Plugged in a Roku Express with power coming from USB on TV into port 1, Plugged in Sony Blue-ray player into port 2 powered from power strip. The default is port 1 and it is constantly powered. To use port 2 there is a little switch on top of the Splitter that needs to be pressed. It worked as expected with no discernible difference in picture quality. Not sure how long the device will last, if it ever fails I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: ? with everything

customer_reviews.title: Picture cuts in and out
customer_reviews.text: This was for our Switch and Firestick so we don’t have to keep unplugging them but there are problems. Namely with the Firestick. The picture keeps cutting out and then popping up without sound. I’ve tried troubleshooting the problem. Maybe it’s asking too much of this splitter connecting it to the Firestick. The connection works well for the Switch. But if they don’t both work well then what’s the point? Really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Fishgill

customer_reviews.title: Simply working.
customer_reviews.text: This did exactly what i needed it to do. My twin boys have so many things attached to the tv from dvd player to xbox to nintendo switch etc. This was great in helping me to keep them from having to pull out one hdmi to switch to another. All that in and out would ruin the tv. This was simple and my boys knew how to switch from one gadget to another without me having to explain over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: llebron99

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT WAY TO ADDITIONAL HDMI PORT TO A DEVICE
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item so that I could use an Amazon Fire Stick on an older TV that had only one HDMI port. I originally chose this unit because of the integrated TV to splitter cord as that saved a few dollars. I am glad I did, because the Fire Stick overlaps the female port in the middle and after pluging in my TV to the other outboard slot, another cable would not fit in the middle. This would NOT be true if all you were. using were standard HDMI cables. Soitching between devices is a breeze. One small button to get to where you want to be. Appeears to be a quality product. I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: dk

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work with my DVR or Chrome Box
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed another way to plug in my Amazon Fire. The Amazon Fire I found out needed its own spot, so it was plugged into the TV. The Google Chrome Box and my DVR were used with the switchGANA. The Chrome box kept blacking out and the DVR did not work. I switched things around and the Fire is now plugged in the switchGANA and the DVR is unplugged. It does not work at all with this product. No I would not buy this product again. As a matter of fact I have ordered one that can actually be switched off.
customer_reviews.author: Dygit Alyse

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well as one would expect
customer_reviews.text: It's simply not working as one would expect. It works great if you start the source from when the HDMI switch is off, but if you switch while it's being used by an source, it still not switch to the new source and tells my TV "no signal." It won't even switch back to original source as well. I originally got this too be able to connect an Xbox, karaoke machine and pc. Pc works. Karaoke works. Xbox doesn't and I did check to see if Xbox works otherwise and it does. Now I'm going to have a paperweight as I look for one that will work.
customer_reviews.author: mtux96

customer_reviews.title: Best pigtail connector I've used.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of these now (the first one i broke the connector off by user error) and love it. When I broke my first one, I bought a new one of a different brand and It didn't work as well. It would automatically switch inputs often. For example, I had my computer plugged into port one and a Nintendo Switch plugged into port two with port one selected. If the switch was turned on at any point, the connector would automatically switch inputs, something I really didn't like. This connector doesn't do that however. It will stay on the input you have selected, regardless of what power changes in the receiving devices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work longer than 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 2 of these and both failed within 4 months time. They work great initially, but eventually, it stops working on all 3 ports at once. The screen is black and there is no signal passing through the switch to your monitor. Don't waste your money unless you need it for a very short period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up though it can have difficulty finding signals while swapping
customer_reviews.text: This HDMI switch is easy to set up and doesnt require a power outlet. It has three HDMI options to swap between. There is a small button on the top to switch between the three, which will light up the numbers as you swap. I have had a few issues with the HDMI switch getting the signal from my Xbox or my PC. If i swap between the two sometimes i will lose the signal from one and I am forced to restart in order to get the signal again. I am not sure if this is caused by my screen or not, but for $10 it works well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You have to click it everytime you switch devices
customer_reviews.text: Not only do you have to click it each time you want the input to change (no automatic switching unless both devices are off), if you change your OTHER monitor's source, you have to click this three times, cycle through all the options, just to get it to display properly. It is barely functional as a hdmi switch, and the aggravation of this device is not worth the small price tag. Note: This device is compatible with the Macbook pro but it requires you to have a HDMI to USB-C cable. You can't use the $70 luxury Apple dongle.
customer_reviews.author: Damion Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a long time now
customer_reviews.text: No issues or problems with this product. I had previously bought a cheaper version that would drop the signal and switch to an empty channel sometimes on its own which was annoying. Spent a little bit more and bought this one as a replacement and have had none of the same issues, in fact no problems at all. I keep 2 gaming consoles and a DVD player hooked up to this one. Each channel will active on it's own as you turn power on to each device. Never encountered a problem switching between the 3 channels by powering on the different devices. Happy with how well this works.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Mattingly

customer_reviews.title: A decent switch that doesn't require external power
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an HDMI switch that didn't require a separate power connection, as my home theater setup has maxed out all of my available plugs. This fit the bill nicely. The only issue I've encountered is, occasionally, it will not wake up when I turn one of the input devices on. The only fix is to power up a second, then it wakes up and I can proceed. I can only assume this is because it uses the HDMI signal itself as a power source and sometimes it needs an extra "kick" to wake up. It doesn't happen all of the time, and it's not that big of an issue for me, but I thought I'd mention it.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetNut47

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This switch works exactly as advertised. It's a mechanical switch. By that I mean you physically have to push a button to switch from one input to another. The switch does not automatically seek out the input that is on and switch to that device. The picture quality of a signal coming through the switch and displayed on a fairly large TV is no different than the picture quality coming directly from a commercial cable connection. I have only listened to the audio on the TV's speakers, and I hear no discernible difference between the signal passing through the switch, and a signal that does not.
customer_reviews.author: Lewes Martin

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Before it died it worked perfectly fine. The switch button was very small but it worked. The light illuminated properly for each Hdmi source. 2 sources. Today I was moving it to fit a third hdmi source and the light went out and all input stopped. Obviously it could no longer switch. I didn't even get the third source in yet. I Just moved the device slightly to allow for the new cable. Obviously I plugged and unplugged. All connections were secure. This was only my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Kjaerynn

customer_reviews.title: Automatic HMDI Source Switching for 4K monitor without any apparent degradation
customer_reviews.text: Used this to provide automated switching of HDMI inputs between my Macbook PRO and PS4 both connected to different HDMI ports, was a pain to keep changing the source, till I used this device which worked like a charm out of the box. Simple and easy to use - just works Update 3 Feb 2020: I have noticed that the connection from my Macbook pro flickers, every minute or so - not sure what the root cause is, will need to take time to investigate further (bringing my review down to a 3 - since it may not be useable)
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Senkomago Musoke

customer_reviews.title: 3port HDMI switch works perfectly but 1 quark
customer_reviews.text: I bought the GNEA 3 port HDMI switch to allow my 1 HDMI port TV to connect to 3 HDMI devices video quality is great my Roku and Blu-Ray player look just as good as plugged directly into my TV's HDMI port My only complaint is that the numbering is funky the right most HDMI port is port 1 and port 3 is the center port when powered on it always defults to port 1 a quark but NOT a deal breaker 100% would buy agian WILL recommend to friends and family
customer_reviews.author: Philip Marquis

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play - wish cable was a bit longer
customer_reviews.text: I used this to add ports to a TV. Added 2 game consoles and the cable box. It appears that the device is powered via the cable box, as that is when the power light turns on. I wish the cable would have been longer since you have to push a button on the device to toggle between inputs. The cable is just over a foot long. If you already have to reach to the back of the TV to push a button, you may as well just unplug and plug your HDMI inputs Otherwise, it does work well.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it!
customer_reviews.text: Does it work? Kinda. Is it convenient? Hard nope. Why would you fashion such a short cord on something like this and then not provide a remote to flip between inputs? This device is supposed to “detect” which input you’re wanting. IE switching to cable when you turn on the television, switching to DVD if that is powered on but that has never been the case for my device. So instead, I find myself consistently rooting around behind the television to attempt to find the thing to change the input.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Ps4 didn’t like it, but everything else did.
customer_reviews.text: For some reason our TV only has 2 HDMI even though everything is HDMI now. So I bought this so we could have both our fire stick, ps4 and Nintendo switch all plugged in at the same time. I will say for whatever reason the ps4 didn’t like it, but the switch and fire stick were fine. I didn’t attempt to troubleshoot much with the ps4 so I don’t know if it was user error or not, but we just ended up plugging the ps4 into the tv and everything else into this extender.
customer_reviews.author: doodynutz

customer_reviews.title: Well built, works exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I use a Windows computer (Surface Go) and a Samsung Galaxy S9-Plus with Samsung's DEX, both on my desktop. I thought I would need to acquire a monitor with two HDMI ports for a few hundrend bucks but instead I got this 3-port HDMI switch. This is a really nice and well built device. It requires no power cord, has a short HDMI that connects to your monitor and three female HDMI ports for devices. It has one push-button to select the output and an LEDthat indicates which is selected. It works flawlessly and I get to keep my Samsung 32-inch curved screen monitor.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: So far as I'm aware it works great!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I have not yet had the opportunity to fully test this HDMI Switcher (all three systems plugged in at once), because I do not yet have the proper shelving to arrange them nor yet do I have the Component to HDMI converter that the Wii will require... But what I have experienced works just fine, the PS3's signal passing through and with no visual or audio degradation. When I am able to connect the PS3, Xbox 360 and Wii as I intend, and when I have tested the switcher thoroughly, I will update the review. Thanks GANA! You make a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Manns

customer_reviews.title: A great littlle cost effective device
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to combine my cable box, Chromestick and DVD player. It's much better than having to go to the TV's remote to select 3 different inputs every time I changed devices. With this device, I have 3 inputs, and 1 output that goes to my TV. A simple push button on the unit chooses my device to be used. The only fallback that I have is that the output cable is a bit short, and I had to use a HDMI extension. Other than that, it's a great buy for under $10.
customer_reviews.author: Patric J. Amarando

customer_reviews.title: Very Slick!
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaces one that supported only 2 HDMI inputs. So now my old plasma big screen with only one HDMI input can lumber along with DVD Movies or Amazon TV or Cable TV at, literally, the push of a button. There is no degradation in picture quality for Cable TV with the new unit. I may be dreaming but the picture seems a smidgen clearer. And for ease of use: it is amazing how much technology has improved these devices. Prices have dropped as well. Glad I make the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t like the built in tail?
customer_reviews.text: I use this Switch more gaming and streaming switching between my Xbox and PC on one monitor. It looks great it 1080p with no real noticeable lag. If you need to connect a longer HDMI cord to the output, I used a small screwdriver to detach the plate and remove the small built in hdmi and i plugged in a longer hdmi to go to my monitor. The fit isn’t exact when I put the plate back, but it’s been working for months with no issues. Its also worth mentioning I have this connected to another hdmi Switch and it works
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Great product and well made!
customer_reviews.text: This switch did not work for my needs, but after some research I found out that I was to blame, because what I was using it for wasn't possible. So, I tried it out in another area and it worked great. it is well priced, well made and works well. Too many people give products a bad review because it doesn't work for them, but in reality it's just because that person is either using it wrong or they are asking the product to do something it wasn't designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great switch! Zero problems!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this switch for a few months now and have had ZERO problems! Very easy to use and no issues. Plug the single HDMI end into your monitor or TV. Then plug your devices into one of the three ports. Single button operation to switch between devices. LED light shows you which port is the active port. I have my computer, SNES classic and a Raspberri pi connected all at the same time. I do not have 4K devices so could not test that.
customer_reviews.author: S. Olski

customer_reviews.title: Works well, auto switches if something isn't on; manual button comes in handy with multiple screens.
customer_reviews.text: This device works really well. It will auto select the source if the source is the only source active. If not, there's a small button on the top you can hit to select one of 3 sources. The weight is well balanced so there's no lifting or odd cable awkwardness. Thinking about buying another one for our 4 port smart tv since we're running out of hdmi inputs. Would be nice if they made a usb keyboard / mouse kvm too with these features. Would go out of my way to buy this brand in the future as it's well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Holy $#i@ this thing is easy to use! Turn on the TV and turn on a device (console for me more specifically), and this things automatically knows exactly what input to pull from! It’s probably also really good for the cables not having to get unplugged and plugged in all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Jijina

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!!!  Quick hookup
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use without an external power supply. It took almost no time to hook up and use. I wish I had found this product sooner. The output cord is shorter than I would have preferred and I thought it would hang under the tv which is wall mounted. No issues though because the tv has ties to secure input cables which allows the unit to stay hidden. Minor criticism: The output cable could be longer or offer just an output port to use whatever length of HDMI cable is needed. Inspite of that, I would buy another one!
customer_reviews.author: NCMichele

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work For Me
customer_reviews.text: I have a plasma monitor that I want to be able to stream content onto. However, it's old and doesn't have an HDMI port, so I was hoping this would work with my cable box somehow. This seems to work primarily for TV's with their own speakers (if older) or TV's that have receive their signals directly (my monitor needs an HDMI to DVI to receive the picture and a AV receiver connected to cable to have sound played along). It also felt kind of cheap - if you're trying to workaround an old monitor, don't waste your money and just start saving for a new TV.
customer_reviews.author: O truant Muse

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to have enough space.
customer_reviews.text: With the ever increasing amount of devices using hdmi you're going to run out of ports. I found this product and loved how it helped me add more devices to my tv but while it worked you must have enough space for this switch box. I have every limited space and while this helped I broke the tv end connector while moving my tv for cleaning. In all if you are looking to add ports to your tv or monitor then this is for you. Just remember to use a extension cable or have enough room not to rip it out by accident.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L. Bycek

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what you need!
customer_reviews.text: I needed the ability to switch quickly between different HDMI sources for my computer monitor. The HDMI switch does exactly that. It's long enough to reach the base of the monitor and allows me to switch sources with the simple touch of a button. Light source lets me see what sources I'm switching between, and the delay is only 1-2 seconds before the new screen is up. 1 less star from my standpoint, because of the button used to switch between sources; so far, it gets the job done; but; is small, knobby, and less than super sturdy; that being said; it continues to work for me, without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 100% Good, I have purchased 3 of them so far
customer_reviews.text: Nice Device that works 100% of the time in my studio. I bought one and then bought 2 more. At a price of about $10, it is really a bargain. Gold printing, shiny black and gold colored connectors with a simple to use push button make this a really nice product. I have no connection with the manufacturer or distributor. I forgot to mention that in my application, it works both ways, input and output can be reversed. W6LG
customer_reviews.author: W6LG

customer_reviews.title: Great Product at a Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I needed an HDMI signal splitter that I could use to support a new Sound Bar I added to my Living Room set-up. I had Dish Network, PS4 and Apple TV to connect through the Sound Bar and the Splitter worked brilliantly. All three HDMI devices route through the Splitter into the sound bar and then a single HDMI cable routes into my TV. While not as many HDMI ports as the Splitter I use for my multiple game console / Dish Network set-up in my media room, for a location that does not require as many inputs, this cable was fantastic - not just in performance but also for price.
customer_reviews.author: R. Reagan

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product so I didn't have my kids asking me to switch the tv to games, fire stick, etc. It worked just fine. They press the button and just use whatever they want. I don't give it 5 stars because the problem I had is that the cable input ports are too close together, it was impossible to connect 3 HDMIs at the same time so I am just using the 2 outside ports, the middle one is unusable because no cable will fit there with the other 2 already connected.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Sanchez M.

customer_reviews.title: Bring modern features to old televisions
customer_reviews.text: I plugged this into an older TV, one that does not automatically switch to the video source that has an active signal. And this splitter does just that, as described, bringing this new feature to an old device. It is also very easy to change the source manually if need be. I appreciate that you can prioritize which source takes precedence too. This product is easy to use and does exactly what it says. I have already recommended it to others. As I write this I have only used it for a few weeks, so if anything changes I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Brighid Kitten

customer_reviews.title: Bad connections
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work for a few minutes, then the connection either flashes on and off or gets a bunch of static. I had hoped to use this to switch between my Playstation 4 and Xbox One, but it is useless for that purpose. I would switch to one console or the other, and after a few minutes it would start losing connection for a second or two randomly. It was the same way with either console. The hardware must be cheap and not terribly reliable. I'd recommend you not waste your money with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: CirclesInTheSand

customer_reviews.title: so it does the job just fine. One thing I dislike is that you have ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but one inconvenient issue... I use this to switch between my work laptop and personal PC. I don't get any loss of quality or noise or anything, so it does the job just fine. One thing I dislike is that you have to press the button to get past unused ports; so in order to get from my PC to Laptop, I have to press the button twice instead of just once to switch between the two. Oh well, still better than the more expensive options!
customer_reviews.author: Julian Sisko

customer_reviews.title: Causes lag
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to be a solution for my older TV and lack of HDMI cables. It does allow me to have multiple inputs but it is not seamless. This creates a lag (on everything). You have to be patient when even turning the TV on! It also sometimes just starts blinking the screen black and I have to get up and reset. I will continue to work with it but I am very close to returning as it really affects my viewing quality and is super frustrating
customer_reviews.author: Kirkdiggler

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy way to set up multiple HDMI devices to a TV with one HDMI port.
customer_reviews.text: My father has a TV with one HDMI port. He had multiple devices, DVD, cable set top box, etc. When I bought him a Chromecast to use YouTube I needed a splitter like this. It was simple for him to switch between devices. There's one button that cycles through each port. Very straight forward. Future proof yourself and buy the 4k version, I can't attest to its ability though since he didnt have a 4k TV.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: There is no remote control or sleep mode, but there is no option for a N/A rating so I gave it 5 stars on those. Plug and play, it's that simple. I'm using it to switch my 24" monitor between my Windows desktop and 2 Raspberry Pi. A KVM would be better, but they cost a lot more and once the Pi has remote control software installed I can use the desktop, so this was to get me started with Pi's. A good unit at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Wally Shangle

customer_reviews.title: Works, not good for consoles
customer_reviews.text: The switch is plug and play. It's great if you're plugging in things like a bluray player and chromecast. It's terrible for game consoles because it delays video transmission. So if you input a command on the controller, the console will read it but you won't see the result until 1.5-3 seconds later on the TV. Auto detection of chromecast works when game console is turned off. And it will skip empty ports when using the button to switch. Two stars because I purchased this for use with game consoles. If your application doesn't involve timing of inputs this product will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Penn

customer_reviews.title: Worked well at first....
customer_reviews.text: Received this item and it was easy to install and use. Since I'm not super techy, I did not notice if the resolution was as described but it all looked good. However, almost two months later (purchased 03/27) and the item is not working as it should. The button you have to press to switch from one electronic to another doesn't work at first press. You have to press it multiple, MULTIPLE, times to have it switch. Pressing it firmly doesn't help either. You just have to press it numerous times to make the switch. I would return it if I could, or at least exchange it but it's too late now.
customer_reviews.author: E.G.E

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use just plug everything in and Vuala!! Everything switches over with the push of a button, makes things so much easier since I use a projector (with only on HDMI outlet) for all my viewing pleasures. I had one issue with my NSwitch that the seller was more than happy to try to help me with, fast responses and very much so willing to replace for a new one or even a full refund (though I did figure out what was going on :)
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Handy device for media or compter monitors
customer_reviews.text: I i initially purchased this to switch between HDMI media sources for a TV, but didn't need it after moving to all streamed video. In my home office I was getting sick of switching HDMI cables back and forth for computer monitors & started looking for a better solution when I remembered I had this unit. It works perfectly for an environment with multiple PC's and several monitors & I'm getting a second one of these to extend this flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Harris

customer_reviews.title: Smart product and very convenient
customer_reviews.text: Our tv, which is about 6 years old, only has two hdmi outlets. With an Apple TV, blu-Ray player, and directv box all needing ports, this switch is super helpful. Beats unplugging and plugging in the cords each time we use a different component! Just walk over to the tv and push the button to activate the desired hdmi.
customer_reviews.author: TNC

customer_reviews.title: 2 failed within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 and They worked good for about a 2 months then one started to have 2 failing HDMI ports (really quiet, glitchy) then my other one did the same. Not to sure what to do.
customer_reviews.author: joshua daily

customer_reviews.title: Finikey (does not always work as designed)
customer_reviews.text: I finally gave up using it and now have a monitor with 3 inputs (HDMI, DVI, and VGA) along with adapters to convert their signal to what the monitor requires and everything works great now... I bought an adapter to convert one of my devices from HDMI to VGA on my monitor... The 3-to-1 HDMI Switch was a total waste of money and is now in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wiese

customer_reviews.title: Not automatic.
customer_reviews.text: I have a similar device on another gaming, tv set up, that switches automatically. I was disappointed to find that this one does not switch automatically. For instance. I have our cable tv using one outlet and our gaming counsel plugged into the other. If I decide to quit watching tv and turn on the gaming counsel, the other device will understand that I am using the gaming HDMI input and automatically switch from #1 (cable) to #2 (Xbox). This switch requires getting up and manually change from 1 to 2 and vice versa.
customer_reviews.author: Charmel459

customer_reviews.title: Received 2 units DOA
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to adding this to our A/V setup. The first unit arrived, I plugged it in, the source light light up on the correct source, but no picture appeared. I tried multiple sources and they all had the same issue. Connecting the source directly worked fine. I returned my first unit, thinking it was a fluke, and tried a second one. I am having the same issue with the second unit. I'll now be looking for a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Bryon F

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy unless you want to throw away your money .
customer_reviews.text: I waited to write a review just to make sure I had time with it. But this little device really didn't last after a month.I mainly used it for both my classic NES , SNES, and Nintendo switch and then black screen saying No Signal LOL. If your thinking of giving money away go for it. I don't recommend at all ...... Im gonna give it a try contacting customer support and see were it goes from there 😞
customer_reviews.author: Geek Castro

customer_reviews.title: I needed this for the many thing to plug in my TV.
customer_reviews.text: This is made life easier. I don't have to keep going to the back of my TV. It was a pain in the butt to unplug one and plug in a different one cord. Just depending which machine I needed or was going to be using. Now everything is plugged in and I can use the remote control. I am very happy to not have to switch out plugs anymore they are all plugged in and easy access. A lot less work makes me happy!! A one time hook up, the plugs are in and its done!
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: I got this so that I wouldn’t have to run 2 more cables through my wall. The TV started muting if we turned on a light switch, the screen would go to snow or just completely turn off if someone turned on water anywhere in the house. We thought the TV went bad so we bought a new one. SAME PROBLEM!!!! unplugged the fire stick, same issues. Finally disconnected the splitter and the problems stopped! So we bought a new TV for no reason. Never thought to check a splitter as the cause.
customer_reviews.author: cor1973

customer_reviews.title: Get this one!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the HDMI splitter with only two ports, and it just didn't work. It needed two more HDMI cables (adding to the clog behind the TV) and the weight of the splitter kept unplugging the cables from the TV. This one transitions smoothly between the Roku and the PS4 with no extra cables needed or special instructions. It's literally just plug and done. And it has three ports, so if we ever need more space, we have it.
customer_reviews.author: Marz

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy, and works!  Just wish there was a remote
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening the package, I immediately plugged it in. I have an older (maybe from 2004) Samsung pedestal tv with only one HDMI port. I plugged this is and was able to easily hook up my fire stick and cable box. The only down side is there is no remote, so when I do actually want to watch my cable/DVR, I have to get up and click the button. Not bad, gets me a couple extra steps in for the day.
customer_reviews.author: TK4LOVE

customer_reviews.title: Hang your blu ray,digital tuner,VCR etc on your tv with this product
customer_reviews.text: Supports 3 HDMI items you want to attach to your t.v.but don't have the connections on your tv to support it. It has a button you push to activate the item you want to use. Would prefer a small remote to keep from getting up to switch the input but not a deal breaker. Easy to connect, no real setup,plug your players hd cable into this product and this product plugs into your hdmi port on your tv. Favorable price point for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Bluesboy

customer_reviews.title: Oh well..........
customer_reviews.text: I got a couple weeks out of it. Then it started dropping the connection. Blank screen while the tv tried to find the video source. At first, once or twice an hour. Next day,...every few mins. Checked wires and they were fine. Unplugged-it and yup,...it was the problem. As we had a new tv, we weren't sure which device was to blame. Guess I'll look elsewhere for a better quality switch. Try to save money?,....sometimes, live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: J.Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Works great but LED light stays on.
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. I connect my cable, Google Chromecast and my DVD player to my TV. There is a switch which allows you to switch which channel is coming through. The active channel is notified by a red LED light. I noticed however that the red LED light stays on even when the TV is turned off or even when the TV is unplugged. This bothers me a little because it tells me the switch is pulling power from the TV or there is a battery which keeps the LED light on. I think this is a unnecessary function but it's a really minor thing. Function-wise, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Domo-Kun

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Switch!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase. Works very well. I have a 22in tv with only two hdmi inputs so I needed a switch to connect my Firestick and a DVD player. In the second I put I have a Roku . I initially thought it would be an issue with two devices in hdmi 1 but their seems to be no conflict because only one device is on at the same time. It conveniently lights up When switching from hdmi 1 to hdmi 2.
customer_reviews.author: P Gantt

customer_reviews.title: Easy hookup and operation.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says it will. Just plug it into the HDMI jack on the TV, hook up the devices (up to three), and push the little button to switch between them. This is way better than what I was doing - reaching behind the TV to unplug the satellite dish to change to Firestick, and back again to watch regular TV. It's much easier to just push the button on the switcher.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work for me
customer_reviews.text: This thing only works with one hdmi cord attached. When I attach more than one it stops working. I've switched to the correct hdmi setting on the TV and device and it seriously does not work if you have more than one connected to it. So yea I've had to stick with swapping out hdmi cords whenever i want to switch game systems.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: Should say for computers only. 2020 Sony tv 65” I just bought.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it can handle a load. Just bought a Sony 65” tv with 3 hdmi ports. Tv told me today to disconnect usb device which was the three port hdmi. So I did. PlayStation 4 Xbox 360 plus Firestick was connected to the three port device I just bout. Not sure but I have 23 days left to see if I can get a good configuration if not the 3 port is Doomed for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Agent 87

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you only have one HDMI port
customer_reviews.text: My TV only came with two HDMI ports, and one of them broke somehow. I was constantly having to switch my HDMI cords out, depending on whether I wanted to watch something on cable or wanted to use my streaming device. This allows me to keep both cords plugged in, and just push a button behind my TV. I would give it five stars if it had a remote that didn't require me leaving my couch!
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: works great, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have a blu ray, a PlayStation, and I have 1 hdmi loose to plug into a PC or a Roku, works great doesn't hurt the pitcher. It also seem to be some what smart as long as you only have 1 device on it will automatically use that line . EXP if i turn on my plays station as long as my blu ray is off with the other cable loose it automatically put the live line through.
customer_reviews.author: David F.

customer_reviews.title: GAMERS ASSIST
customer_reviews.text: My son has his laptop linked to 3 or maybe more Nintendo devices for creating uploads to his MKWhippy YouTube Gaming Channel. In the video he shows me how much more easier it is since his ASUS laptop only has one HDMI port. I could also see a use for me with my MacBook when I use it for my DJ Business - all for under $10!
customer_reviews.author: EXCLUSIVE SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Good

customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough, but has some electrical issues.
customer_reviews.text: I've got two different game consoles plugged into this, and while it works perfectly fine, every time my mini-fridge turns on or off, it drops signal to the TV for about 3 seconds. The fridge is plugged into one socket, and everything else is plugged into a power strip on the 2nd socket. Literally every single time the fridge starts or stops its cooling process, the TV drops signal for 3 or 4 seconds. Really obnoxious, but other than that it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W

customer_reviews.title: You can pay a lot more but I doubt you'll get any better.
customer_reviews.text: What to do when there are more HDMI sources than ports? This is the simple solution. I keep my Firestick in # 1 and use this switch so Chromecast and my blue ray player can share HDMI # 2. That still leaves spare port on the switch should I even get an additional source. The only downside is that I had to carefully place it away from my over-the-air antenna connection to avoid interference. That was easily solved.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and easy.
customer_reviews.text: It serves its purpose to be able to have multiple devices hooked up to my son tv my 5 year old autistic son can switch it himself because the button makes it simple to navigate between which device he wants to use. I am currently using it on a wii u, ps4, xbox one. I have the switcher connected to the tv as well as a nintendo switch and that suits our needs for now. But I do wish there was one with more ports for the future if i need space for more devices.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Jerzy

customer_reviews.title: Our son thought this item was great!
customer_reviews.text: We recently decided to "cut the cord" and purchased a device to stream our television signals, but unfortunately, it also meant that we would need a switch for our son's room (since he, like most teenagers, uses a LOT of devices that need HDMI access). We saw this GANA 3 port HDMI switch and he loves it! At the touch of a button, he can easily go from the television to one of his gaming devices to his computer. Of course, if he is pleased with it, than we, as his parents, are pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Birdsong
